item.title: 普惠公司高管预计发动机供应失衡将在本世纪末趋于平稳
item.description: 普惠商用发动机公司总裁周四表示，喷气发动机强劲的行业需求正以超过供应的速度增长，这种态势将在本世纪末趋于平稳。【原文：Strong industry demand for jet engines which is outpacing supply should start to level off at the end of the decade, Pratt & Whitney's president of commercial engines said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家：马斯克旗下SpaceX正与xAI进行合并谈判，此举发生在计划中的首次公开募股之前
item.description: 据知情人士透露，并罗伊特社看到的两份近期公司文件显示，此次合并将使马斯克旗下的火箭、星链卫星、X社交媒体平台和Grok人工智能聊天机器人整合到同一屋檐下。【原文：The combination would bring Musk’s rockets, Starlink satellites, the X social media platform and ​Grok AI chatbot under one roof, according to a person briefed on the matter and two recent company filings seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国议员就委内瑞拉石油交易质询维托尔、托克公司
item.description: 美国众议院调查委员会的民主党首席成员周四要求全球贸易公司维托尔和托克提供在美方抓捕委内瑞拉领导人前与特朗普政府往来的任何通信记录，他表示此举旨在查明谁从该行动中获益。【原文：The top Democrat on a U.S. House investigative committee on Thursday asked global trading houses Vitol and Trafigura about any correspondence with the Trump administration before the U.S. capture of Venezuela's leader, to determine, he said, who benefits from that action.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯2025年创下销售纪录，计划回购12亿美元股票
item.description: 阿迪达斯周四表示，其2025年销售额创下历史新高，并宣布将启动最高10亿欧元（约合12亿美元）的股票回购计划。这家德国运动服饰制造商在关税压力下成功维持了价格相对稳定。【原文：Adidas on Thursday said its sales hit a record in 2025, adding it would launch a share buyback of up 1 billion euros ($1.2 billion) as the German sportswear maker managed to keep prices fairly stable in the face of tariffs.】

item.title: 加密货币法案在美国参议院取得进展，但仍面临障碍
item.description: 美国参议院农业委员会周四以党派投票方式推进了一项法案，该法案旨在为加密货币建立联邦监管框架。这表明该立法可能缺乏足够支持，难以在参议院全体会议上获得通过。【原文：The U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee, which oversees commodities trading, advanced a bill on Thursday ‌that would establish a federal regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies on a party-line vote, an indication that the legislation likely lacks enough support to be passed by the full Senate.】

item.title: 特朗普称礼来公司将在美国新建六家工厂
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周四表示，他已与制药公司礼来公司负责人通话，该公司计划在美国境内新建六家工厂。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that he has spoken to the head of pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly and that the company plans to build six plants in the country.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯首席执行官称欧盟放宽电动汽车目标的细节可能抵消其效益
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰首席执行官周四表示，欧盟在电动汽车转型方面放宽目标的细则，可能抵消其预期效益。【原文：The fine print of the European Union's relaxed targets in the shift to electric cars risks cancelling out the intended benefits, the CEO of Mercedes-Benz said on Thursday.】

item.title: 奥巴马医改计划2026年参保人数降至约2300万人
item.description: 2026年，美国奥巴马医改计划的参保人数减少逾百万，总参保量降至约2300万人。由于新冠疫情期间的额外医疗保险补贴到期，许多参保者的月保费大幅上涨。【原文：More than a million fewer Americans have signed up for Obamacare plans for 2026, with enrollment dropping to about 23 million as monthly premiums for many soared due to the expiration of extra COVID-19 pandemic health insurance subsidies.】

item.title: 安赛乐米塔尔就钢铁厂纠纷向意大利提出20亿美元索赔
item.description: 跨国钢铁巨头安赛乐米塔尔公司周四表示，已就其投资意大利钢铁企业Acciaierie d'Italia（ADI）工厂所产生的损失，向意大利政府提出18亿欧元（约合22亿美元）的索赔。该公司曾是ADI的控股股东。【原文：Multinational steelmaker ArcelorMittal , the former owner of Italian steel firm Acciaierie d'Italia (ADI), said on Thursday it had filed a 1.8 billion euro ($2.2 billion) claim against the Italian government over losses linked to its investment in ADI's plants.】

item.title: 保险平台Ethos Technologies在纳斯达克上市首日估值达12亿美元
item.description: Ethos Technologies周四在纳斯达克上市首日估值达12亿美元，随着IPO市场持续走强，保险公司正不断获得投资者青睐。【原文：Ethos Technologies clinched a valuation of $1.2 billion in its ​Nasdaq debut on Thursday, as insurance firms continue to find receptive investors ‌in a strengthening IPO market.】

item.title: 美国航空计划在特朗普政府开放领空后重启美国至委内瑞拉的航班
item.description: 美国航空公司周四表示，计划在政府批准并完成安全评估后，恢复每日飞往委内瑞拉的航班。此前数周，美国军方曾扣押该国领导人。【原文：American Airlines said on Thursday it plans to resume daily service to Venezuela pending government approval and subject to security assessments, just weeks after the U.S. military seized the country's leader.】

item.title: York Space在纽交所首日上市股价飙升，估值达47.5亿美元
item.description: 约克太空系统公司上市首日估值达47.5亿美元，投资者押注五角大楼持续的太空与国防开支将推动其增长。【原文：York Space Systems clinched a valuation of $4.75 billion in its market debut, as investors bet on sustained Pentagon spending on ​space and defense to drive growth.】

item.title: 特朗普计划下周宣布其美联储主席人选
item.description: 特朗普总统表示，他计划下周宣布接替美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的人选，这将结束数周以来关于谁将在鲍威尔2026年5月任期届满后领导美国央行的猜测。【原文：President Trump said he intends to announce his pick to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell next week, ending weeks of speculation over who will lead the U.S. central bank after Powell’s term expires in May 2026.】

item.title: 巴蒂斯塔兄弟旗下PicPay估值达25亿美元，纳斯达克首日上市股价飙升
item.description: 由亿万富翁巴蒂斯塔家族控股的PicPay公司股票周四在纳斯达克首日上市即大涨2.6%，使这家巴西数字银行的估值达到25.3亿美元。【原文：Shares ​of PicPay , ‌controlled by the ‌billionaire Batista ​family, jumped ‍2.6% in their ⁠Nasdaq ‍debut on Thursday, ‌valuing ‌the Brazilian ⁠digital ⁠bank ​at $2.53 billion.】

item.title: First Brands创始人帕特里克·詹姆斯及其兄弟因欺诈罪被起诉
item.description: 第一品牌集团创始人帕特里克·詹姆斯及其兄弟爱德华在纽约被起诉，指控其在汽车零部件公司破产前涉嫌欺诈贷款方数亿美元。【原文：First Brands ​Group founder Patrick James and his ‌brother Edward have been indicted in New York for allegedly defrauding lenders out of billions of dollars before the auto ‌parts company collapsed into bankruptcy.】

item.title: 苹果收购音频人工智能初创公司Q.ai
item.description: 苹果公司周四宣布已收购以色列初创企业Q.ai，该公司专注于音频人工智能技术领域。【原文：Apple on Thursday said it has acquired Q.ai, an Israeli startup working on artificial intelligence technology for audio.】

item.title: 星巴克在首席执行官尼科尔首次投资者日上寻求疫情前利润率
item.description: 星巴克高管在周四举行的投资者日上表示，公司正致力于恢复至疫情前的利润水平，目标是在2028财年实现净收入增长5%或以上，并达到每股收益3.35至4美元。【原文：Starbucks is seeking to return to pre-pandemic margins, executives said at the company's investor day held Thursday, targeting net revenues up 5% or more and annual earnings per share of $3.35 to $4 by fiscal year 2028.】

item.title: 道奇因"限量版"SUV生产政策反转胜诉
item.description: 道奇汽车制造商的母公司周四击败了2021款道奇杜兰戈SRT地狱猫车主的消费者欺诈和虚假广告诉讼。车主们称，当两年后该车型增产时，他们购买的"限量版"SUV价值大幅缩水。【原文：The parent of automaker Dodge on Thursday defeated a consumer fraud and false advertising lawsuit brought by owners of 2021 Dodge Durango SRT Hellcats, who said their "limited edition" SUVs lost value when more were made two years later.】

item.title: 黑石集团支持的Liftoff Mobile计划在美国IPO中实现高达52亿美元的估值
item.description: 移动应用营销服务商Liftoff Mobile周四表示，其在美国首次公开募股（IPO）的目标估值高达51.7亿美元。作为黑石集团旗下最新一家即将登陆新股市场的企业，该公司正瞄准这一估值目标。【原文：Mobile app marketing provider Liftoff Mobile said on Thursday it was targeting a valuation of up ​to $5.17 billion in its initial public offering in the United ‌States, the latest Blackstone portfolio company set to tap the new listings market.】

item.title: 尽管存在关税，瑞士对美出口在2025年仍实现增长
item.description: 瑞士联邦海关总署周四表示，2025年瑞士对美出口额增长3.9%，增速超过整体出口增幅。尽管这个阿尔卑斯山国家面临着全球最高的美国关税之一，出口仍实现增长。【原文：Switzerland's exports to the United States rose 3.9% in 2025, the federal customs office ​said on Thursday, outpacing overall export growth ‌despite the Alpine country facing some of the highest U.S. tariffs worldwide.】

item.title: 皇家加勒比邮轮公司上调年度盈利预期，因需求强劲；股价大涨
item.description: 皇家加勒比邮轮公司周四预测全年利润将超出华尔街预期，这得益于富裕旅客的强劲需求以及关键预订季的良好开局。【原文：Royal Caribbean forecast annual profit above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, supported by strong demand from affluent ​travelers and a solid start to a key booking season.】

item.title: 瓦莱罗能源公司表示将从三家供应商处购买委内瑞拉原油
item.description: 瓦莱罗能源公司周四在电话会议上表示，已与三家委内瑞拉原油授权销售商达成合作，并将从这三家供应商处采购原油。【原文：Valero Energy has engaged with three authorized sellers of Venezuelan crude and will purchase barrels from all three of them, it said on a conference call on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西央行官员称，巴西BRB银行可能因与Banco Master的交易蒙受近10亿美元损失
item.description: 巴西央行一位官员在向联邦警察作证时表示，巴西国有银行BRB可能需要拨出超过50亿雷亚尔（约合9.7亿美元）的资金，用于覆盖与倒闭银行Banco Master的交易。路透社看到了这份证词。【原文：Brazilian state-run bank BRB will likely have to set aside more than 5 billion reais ($970 million) to cover transactions with failed lender Banco Master, a ​central bank director told the federal police in testimony seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称空客将启动更大机型A220客机的销售攻势
item.description: 据行业消息人士透露，空客公司正准备向航空公司和租赁公司推出其A220支线客机的加大版机型，计划于今年晚些时候启动研发工作。【原文：Airbus is poised to start offering airlines and leasing firms a larger version of its A220 regional jet with a view to launching development later this year, industry sources said.】

item.title: 芯片巨头ASML即将触顶，还是即将突破？
item.description: ASML最新财报曾重新点燃其股价涨势，使其成为欧洲市值最高的企业，但随后市场对其能否满足创纪录订单量的质疑导致股价下跌——这凸显出市场预期已然被过度拉伸。【原文：ASML's latest results reignited the rally that has made it Europe's most valuable company, until questions about its capacity to meet record orders sent the stock sliding - highlighting just how stretched expectations have become.】

item.title: 萨尔瓦多与美国签署贸易协定
item.description: 萨尔瓦多驻美大使米莱娜·马约加周四表示，萨尔瓦多已与美国签署贸易协定，但未透露协议具体内容。【原文：El Salvador has signed a trade agreement with the United States, El Salvador's ambassador to the U.S. Milena Mayorga said on Thursday, without adding details on the content of the deal.】

item.title: 铜价突破14,000美元引发投资者两难抉择
item.description: 周四铜价飙升至每吨14,000美元以上，令投资者面临是否追涨的抉择。【原文：Copper's red-hot run to above $14,000 a metric ton on Thursday leaves investors facing a decision over whether or not to chase the market higher.】

item.title: 世界发现可对冲美国贸易风险
item.description: 在未来许多年里，美国的盟友们都无法设想摆脱对美军实力的依赖，也无法挑战硅谷巨头们的技术霸权。【原文：It will be many years before the United States' allies can contemplate dispensing with the need for its military might or challenging the tech supremacy of its Silicon Valley giants.】

item.title: 美国11月工厂订单因商用飞机需求回升
item.description: 美国工厂产品新订单在11月出现反弹，主要得益于商用飞机需求的激增，不过企业设备支出增速在第四季度可能有所放缓。【原文：New orders for U.S. factory goods rebounded in November as demand for commercial aircraft surged, though growth in business ​spending on equipment likely moderated in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 美国批发库存11月再度增长
item.description: 美国批发库存11月出现增长，表明在连续两个季度拖累经济增长后，库存投资有望在第四季度为国内生产总值贡献正向增长。【原文：U.S. wholesale inventories increased in November, suggesting inventory investment could add to gross domestic product in the fourth quarter after being a drag for two straight quarters.】
